item.title: Alexa add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Be not afraid of greatness. Some are born great, some achieve greatness, and others have greatness thrust upon them." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Alexa add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "All's well if all ends well." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Alexa add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "It is a truth universally acknowledged, that a single man in possession of a good fortune, must be in want of a wife." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Alexa add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "If music be the food of love, play on, Give me excess of it; that surfeiting, The appetite may sicken, and so die." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Alexa add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "The fool doth think he is wise, but the wise man knows himself to be a fool." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Alexa add a quote by J.M. Barrie
item.description: "To die would be an awfully big adventure." -- J.M. Barrie

item.title: Alexa add a quote by Roald Dahl
item.description: "And above all, watch with glittering eyes the whole world around you because the greatest secrets are always hidden in the most unlikely places. Those who don't believe in magic will never find it." -- Roald Dahl

item.title: Alexa add a quote by Katherine Paterson
item.description: "Reading can be a road to freedom or a key to a secret garden, which, if tended, will transform all of life." -- Katherine Paterson

item.title: Alexa add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Alexa add a quote by Alfred Lord Tennyson
item.description: "Tis better to have loved and lost Than never to have loved at all." -- Alfred Lord Tennyson

item.title: Alexa add a quote by Alfred Lord Tennyson
item.description: "If I had a flower for every time I thought of you...I could walk through my garden forever." -- Alfred Lord Tennyson

item.title: Alexa add a quote by Zoe Trope
item.description: "sometimes every word i write is 'love' but the letters are rearranged, the sounds are different. all the words are red." -- Zoe Trope

item.title: Alexa add a quote by Zoe Trope
item.description: "Besides, I always feel safer when I've got words against my heart." -- Zoe Trope

item.title: Alexa add a quote by Truman Capote
item.description: "Failure is the condiment that gives success its flavor." -- Truman Capote

item.title: Alexa add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "I would always rather be happy than dignified." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: Alexa add a quote by Toni Morrison
item.description: "At some point in life the world's beauty becomes enough. You don't need to photograph, paint, or even remember it. It is enough." -- Toni Morrison

item.title: Alexa add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The more I know of the world, the more I am convinced that I shall never see a man whom I can really love. I require so much!" -- Jane Austen

item.title: Alexa add a quote by Gabriel García Márquez
item.description: "She would defend herself, saying that love, no matter what else it might be, was a natural talent. She would say: You are either born knowing how, or you never know." -- Gabriel García Márquez

item.title: Alexa add a quote by Betty Smith
item.description: "The world was hers for the reading." -- Betty Smith

item.title: Alexa add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "Kiss me, and you will see how important I am." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Alexa add a quote by Alfred de Musset
item.description: "How glorious it is – and also how painful – to be an exception. " -- Alfred de Musset

item.title: Alexa add a quote by Julian Barnes
item.description: "Books say: She did this because. Life says: She did this. Books are where things are explained to you; life is where things aren't. I'm not surprised some people prefer books." -- Julian Barnes

item.title: Alexa add a quote by Andy Warhol
item.description: "Don't pay any attention to what they write about you. Just measure it in inches." -- Andy Warhol

item.title: Alexa add a quote by William Shakespeare
Alexa add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "You may not control all the events that happen to you, but you can decide not to be reduced by them." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: Alexa add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "All that glisters is not gold; Often have you heard that told: Many a man his life hath sold But my outside to behold: Gilded tombs do worms enfold." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Alexa add a quote by Christopher Morley
item.description: "There is no mistaking a real book when one meets it. It is like falling in love." -- Christopher Morley

item.title: Alexa add a quote by John Cheever
item.description: "I can’t write without a reader. It’s precisely like a kiss—you can’t do it alone." -- John Cheever

item.title: Alexa add a quote by Alan Bennett
item.description: "What she was finding also was how one book led to another, doors kept opening wherever she turned and the days weren't long enough for the reading she wanted to do." -- Alan Bennett

item.title: Alexa add a quote by Federico García Lorca
item.description: "To burn with desire and keep quiet about it is the greatest punishment we can bring on ourselves." -- Federico García Lorca
